title: Progress in Simulations of Magnon EELS
content: Advancements in Electron Energy Loss Spectroscopy (EELS) technology have allowed the examination of inelastic signals with sub-10 meV energy resolution [1, 2]. This has enabled the investigation of vibrational spectroscopies at a high spatial resolution, a development with profound implications for the field of nanotechnology [3]. Notably, within this energy range also lie magnons, quantized spin waves fundamental to ordered magnetism [4]. The ability to analyze magnons with high spatial resolution holds considerable importance in the domains of magnonics and spintronics [5].
